Package space.sunqian.fs.io

Interface CharSegment

All Superinterfaces:
Cloneable
public interface CharSegment extends Cloneable
This interface represents a segment of char data in the data source. It includes the data(), which is the content of this segment, and the end(), which indicates whether this segment is the end of the data.

    • data

      @Nonnull @Nonnull CharBuffer data()
      Returns the data content of this segment. This method never returns null, but can return an empty buffer.
      Returns:
      the data content of this segment

    • end

      boolean end()
      Returns whether this segment is the end of the data source.
      Returns:
      whether this segment is the end of the data source

    • array

      default char @Nonnull [] array()
      Returns the remaining data as a new char array from the data(). This method never returns null, but can return an empty array.

      The buffer's position increments by the actual read number.

      Returns:
      the remaining data as a new char array from the data()

    • copyArray

      default char @Nonnull [] copyArray()
      Returns a new array copied from the remaining content of the data(). Position of the data() will not be changed.
      Returns:
      a new array copied from the remaining content of the data()

    • clone

      @Nonnull @Nonnull CharSegment clone()
      Returns a clone of this segment. The data() of the returned clone is an independent copy, not be shared with the data() of this segment.
      Returns:
      a clone of this segment
